document.docAuthor: Irwin, Michael E. & Winterton, Shaun L.
document.docTitle: Argolepida telteca Irwin & Winterton 2021, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of South American stiletto fly genus Argolepida Metz & Irwin (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of South American stiletto fly genus Argolepida Metz & Irwin (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Emeritus, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign, Illinois, USA, and University of Arizona, Tucson, USA.
California State Collection of Arthropods, California Department of Food & Agriculture, Sacramento, California, USA.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis . Male frons almost entirely pubescent, female with emarginate glabrous area across frons; wing faint infuscate; abdominal tergites 1–5 with white, scale-like adpressed setae; femora brown, sometimes mid- and hind femur yellow.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 29 .
Argolepida telteca
sp. n.
: male, oblique view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology . The species epithet is derived from the type locality, Telteca provincial reserve in Mendoza Province .

Comments .
Argolepida telteca
sp. n.
is closely related to
A. atacama
sp. n.
, with similar markings and frontal patterns. This species is distributed along the Western slopes of the Andes in Northern Argentina ; it overlaps in distribution with
P. rivulosa
and
P. schlingeri
sp. n.

10–23.X.1997
, M.E. Irwin , F.D. Parker , S. Roig (MEI106523; MNBR )
